metadata.title: Trusted Tester Conformance Test Process
metadata.description: DHS Trusted Tester methodology for evaluating web accessibility compliance

testCategories.name: Conforming Alternate Version
testCategories.description: Tests for conforming alternate versions of web content

testCategories.name: Auto-Playing and Auto-Updating Content
testCategories.description: Tests for content that plays automatically or updates without user interaction

testCategories.name: Flashing
testCategories.description: Tests for content that flashes more than 3 times per second

testCategories.name: Keyboard Access and Focus
testCategories.description: Tests for keyboard accessibility and focus management

testCategories.name: Forms
testCategories.description: Tests for form accessibility including labels, instructions, and error handling

testCategories.name: Links and Buttons
testCategories.description: Tests for link and button accessibility

testCategories.name: Images
testCategories.description: Tests for image alternative text and accessibility

testCategories.name: Adjustable Time Limits
testCategories.description: Tests for content with time limits and user control

testCategories.name: Repetitive Content
testCategories.description: Tests for bypass mechanisms for repetitive content

testCategories.name: Content Structure
testCategories.description: Tests for proper content structure including headings and lists

testCategories.name: Language
testCategories.description: Tests for language identification

testCategories.name: Page Titles, Frames, and iFrames
testCategories.description: Tests for page titles and frame accessibility

testCategories.name: Sensory Characteristics and Contrast
testCategories.description: Tests for sensory characteristics and color contrast

testCategories.name: Tables
testCategories.description: Tests for data table accessibility

testCategories.name: CSS Content and Positioning
testCategories.description: Tests for CSS-generated content and positioning

testCategories.name: Pre-Recorded Audio-Only and Video-Only
testCategories.description: Tests for pre-recorded media alternatives

testCategories.name: Synchronized Media
testCategories.description: Tests for synchronized multimedia accessibility

testCategories.name: Resize Text
testCategories.description: Tests for text resizing without loss of content or functionality

testCategories.name: Multiple Ways
testCategories.description: Tests for multiple ways to find content

testCategories.name: Parsing
testCategories.description: Tests for proper HTML parsing

1.1.1.title: Non-text Content
1.1.1.description: All non-text content has a text alternative

1.2.1.title: Audio-only and Video-only (Prerecorded)
1.2.1.description: Alternatives provided for prerecorded audio-only and video-only content

1.2.2.title: Captions (Prerecorded)
1.2.2.description: Captions provided for prerecorded audio in synchronized media

1.2.3.title: Audio Description or Media Alternative (Prerecorded)
1.2.3.description: Audio description or media alternative provided for video

1.2.4.title: Captions (Live)
1.2.4.description: Captions provided for live audio in synchronized media

1.2.5.title: Audio Description (Prerecorded)
1.2.5.description: Audio description provided for video content

1.3.1.title: Info and Relationships
1.3.1.description: Information, structure, and relationships can be programmatically determined

1.3.2.title: Meaningful Sequence
1.3.2.description: Correct reading sequence can be programmatically determined

1.3.3.title: Sensory Characteristics
1.3.3.description: Instructions don't rely solely on sensory characteristics

1.4.1.title: Use of Color
1.4.1.description: Color is not the only visual means of conveying information

1.4.2.title: Audio Control
1.4.2.description: Mechanism to pause or stop auto-playing audio

1.4.3.title: Contrast (Minimum)
1.4.3.description: Text has contrast ratio of at least 4.5:1

1.4.4.title: Resize Text
1.4.4.description: Text can be resized up to 200% without loss of content or functionality

1.4.5.title: Images of Text
1.4.5.description: Text used instead of images of text where possible

2.1.1.title: Keyboard
2.1.1.description: All functionality available from a keyboard

2.1.2.title: No Keyboard Trap
2.1.2.description: Keyboard focus can be moved away from components

2.2.1.title: Timing Adjustable
2.2.1.description: User can turn off, adjust, or extend time limits

2.2.2.title: Pause, Stop, Hide
2.2.2.description: User can pause, stop, or hide moving, blinking, or auto-updating content

2.3.1.title: Three Flashes or Below Threshold
2.3.1.description: Content does not flash more than three times per second

2.4.1.title: Bypass Blocks
2.4.1.description: Mechanism to bypass blocks of repeated content

2.4.3.title: Focus Order
2.4.3.description: Components receive focus in order that preserves meaning

2.4.4.title: Link Purpose (In Context)
2.4.4.description: Purpose of each link can be determined from link text or context

2.4.5.title: Multiple Ways
2.4.5.description: More than one way to locate a web page within a set

2.4.6.title: Headings and Labels
2.4.6.description: Headings and labels describe topic or purpose

3.1.1.title: Language of Page
3.1.1.description: Default language can be programmatically determined

3.1.2.title: Language of Parts
3.1.2.description: Language of each passage can be programmatically determined

3.2.1.title: On Focus
3.2.1.description: Components do not change context on receiving focus

3.2.2.title: On Input
3.2.2.description: Changing component settings does not cause unexpected context change

3.2.3.title: Consistent Navigation
3.2.3.description: Navigation mechanisms are consistent across pages

3.2.4.title: Consistent Identification
3.2.4.description: Components with same functionality are identified consistently

3.3.1.title: Error Identification
3.3.1.description: Errors are identified and described to user in text

3.3.2.title: Labels or Instructions
3.3.2.description: Labels or instructions provided for user input

3.3.3.title: Error Suggestion
3.3.3.description: Suggestions provided when errors are detected

3.3.4.title: Error Prevention (Legal, Financial, Data)
3.3.4.description: Submissions can be reversed, checked, or confirmed

4.1.2.title: Name, Role, Value
4.1.2.description: Name and role can be programmatically determined

testingTools.name: CCA
testingTools.description: Tool for testing color contrast ratios

testingTools.name: Browser DevTools
testingTools.description: Built-in browser developer tools for inspecting HTML

testingTools.name: Screen Reader
testingTools.description: JAWS, NVDA, or VoiceOver for testing with assistive technology

critical.name: Critical
critical.description: Prevents access to content or functionality

high.name: High
high.description: Significantly impairs access to content or functionality

medium.name: Medium
medium.description: Moderately impairs access to content or functionality

dna.label: Does Not Apply
dna.description: Test requirement does not apply to this content

not-tested.label: Not Tested
not-tested.description: Test has not been performed yet

reportTypes.name: Detailed Report
reportTypes.description: Comprehensive report with all test details
